results.idea: Short-term momentum on news release (5-day returns)
results.description: Core: capture short-term momentum after news by ranking 5-day returns. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using news_ton_last and news_spy_last to remove market moves; SUGGESTION2 N/A (no vector fields used); SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage >0.6 for both); SUGGESTION4 used high alpha/userCount fields (news_ton_last userCount 417, news_spy_last userCount 195). Kept implementation concise and within operator/datafield limits per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.75 based on persistent short-term momentum post-news.

results.idea: Immediate 1-minute reaction z-score
results.description: Core: exploit extreme 1-minute moves after news using z-scored 1-min pct change. SUGGESTION1: single strong field news_pct_1min with ts_zscore; SUGGESTION2 not applicable; SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage 0.9406); SUGGESTION4 field has moderate userCount/alphaCount. Followed KEEP_IN_MIND limits. Confidence 0.7 due to high-frequency noise but measurable impact.

results.idea: Post-news mean reversion in 30-min move
results.description: Core: when the 30-minute pct move is extreme, expect partial reversion. Used news_pct_30min zscore and sign reversal. S1 used a single reliable field (coverage 0.9687); S2 none; S3 not needed; S4 field alphaCount moderate. Kept <=2 datafields and few operators. Confidence 0.65 reflecting mean-reversion tendency after spikes.

results.idea: Volatility breakout signal using ATR ratio
results.description: Core: large today-range relative to 20-day ATR signals directional continuation; used news_atr_ratio. S1 single field with ts_zscore; S3 not needed (coverage 0.7967); S4 good userCount. Implementation respects operator/datafield limits. Confidence 0.68 as ATR spikes often precede trends.

results.idea: Volume surge continuation (curr vs 30-day avg)
results.description: Core: high current volume relative to 30-day avg often sustains move. Used news_vol_stddev and news_mov_vol combined for robustness (SUGGESTION1). Both fields have high coverage; S3 not needed. Used multiply to amplify signal. Kept simple per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.72.

results.idea: Earnings surprise directional bias
results.description: Core: positive EPS actual relative to typical (eps_actual zscore) indicates positive drift. S1 used news_eps_actual; S3 not needed (coverage 0.8742); S4 acceptable userCount. KEEP_IN_MIND followed. Confidence 0.73 because earnings surprises often move prices.

results.idea: Post-open gap continuation
results.description: Core: exploit opening gap (opengap) continuation intraday vs market; subtract SPY open gap. S1 uses nws12_mainz_opengap and nws12_mainz_spylast; S3 not needed (coverage 0.9741); S4 fields high counts. Kept short. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Combined size & momentum filter
results.description: Core: larger-cap stocks with strong short-term returns are preferred. Used news_mktcap and ts_returns(t) momentum. S1 uses two fields as suggested; both have high userCount/alphaCount; S3 not needed. Implementation simple and within operator limits. Confidence 0.7.

results.idea: Relative move vs index (index-adjusted return)
results.description: Core: alpha = stock return minus SPY return over 60 minutes to isolate idiosyncratic moves. S1 applied; S3 not needed. Kept concise. Confidence 0.68.

results.idea: Post-news high-excstddev breakout
results.description: Core: large EODHigh - TONLast relative to 30-day std suggests breakout continuation; used news_highexcstddev. S1 single field; high coverage. S3 not needed. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Post-news low-excstddev mean-reversion
results.description: Core: large drop relative to stddev may revert intraday; use low_exc_stddev reversed. S1 used nws12_mainz_lowexcstddev; coverage high. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Short-interest amplified momentum
results.description: Core: heavily shorted stocks that show positive surprise may squeeze; multiply eps surprise zscore by short_interest. S1 used news_eps_actual and news_short_interest; both have decent coverage (short_interest coverage 0.8632). S4 applied. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Volume-adjusted immediate pct move
results.description: Core: amplify 1-min pct change by relative volume (curr_vol / mov_vol). S1 used nws12_mainz_1_minute and nws12_mainz_vol_ratio; coverage high. Kept operators minimal. Confidence 0.69.

results.idea: Tick activity momentum
results.description: Core: increased total ticks indicates strong participation; use news_tot_ticks zscore to predict continuation. S1 single field; high coverage and userCount. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Post-news VWAP divergence
results.description: Core: difference between post_vwap and ton_last signals buying/selling pressure. S1: subtract postvwap - ton_last; both fields have high coverage. S3 not needed. Confidence 0.67.

results.idea: EOD close vs pre-vwap reversion
results.description: Core: large deviation between eod_close and pre_vwap implies intraday mispricing and reversion; use news_eodclose and news_pre_vwap. S1 used two fields; pre_vwap coverage 0.7505 acceptable. Applied KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Short-term cross-sectional zscore of 10-min pct
results.description: Core: take cross-sectional zscore of news_pct_10min to pick extreme movers. S1 used single field; coverage 0.9648. S2 N/A. Kept simple. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Post-news intraday dispersion (range stddev)
results.description: Core: high range_stddev indicates volatile names that often trend; use news_rangestddev. S1 single field; coverage 0.9691 high. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum conditional on low PE
results.description: Core: momentum stronger in low P/E names post-news; multiply momentum by inverse PE. S1 uses news_pe_ratio and ts_returns; used high userCount PE (1187). S3 not needed. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Immediate microstructure signal: 30-sec pct
results.description: Core: exploit 30-second pct change extreme moves after news. S1 uses nws12_mainz_30_seconds (coverage 0.9075). S3 not needed. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Post-news IR of returns (stability measure)
results.description: Core: use ts_ir on short-window returns to find stable directional signals (high IR). S1 applied to nws12_mainz_result1; coverage high. S2 N/A. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Spike then decay pattern: max up amt then ts_decay
results.description: Core: large immediate max_up_amt often decays; use ts_max_diff of maxupamt. S1 used nws12_mainz_maxupamt; high coverage. Kept within operator/datafield limits. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: News-induced micro momentum with winsorization
results.description: Core: winsorize 5-min pct move then rank for robust momentum. S1 uses nws12_mainz_5_min; applied winsorize to reduce outliers. Coverage adequate. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Gap fade when low volume
results.description: Core: open gap likely to fade if open_vol is low relative to mov_vol. S1 uses opengap and mov_vol; opengap coverage high; if mov_vol low, fade. S3 not needed. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Cross-asset correlation breakdown (short-run)
results.description: Core: ts_corr between stock 30-min returns and SPY 30-min returns; low corr suggests idiosyncratic alpha. S1 uses two fields; coverage high. S3 not needed. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Persistence of initial move (argmax timing)
results.description: Core: ts_arg_max on short-window returns to see if current point is peak; if current not max, expect continuation. S1 uses ts_arg_max on 10-min returns. Coverage high. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Volume-normalized breakout using vol_ratio
results.description: Core: use vol_ratio (curr_vol / mov_vol) zscore to capture volume-supported moves. S1 used nws12_mainz_vol_ratio; coverage high. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Earnings surprise persistence over 5 days
results.description: Core: use ts_returns over 5 days after eps_actual surprise. S1 uses nws12_mainz_epsactual and tonlast returns; S2 N/A. Confidence 0.67.

results.idea: High immediate pct and low overall volatility
results.description: Core: big 1-min move in a low-volatility name suggests alpha. Used news_pct_1min and inverse volstddev. S1 uses two fields; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Momentum conditioned on low prior-day range
results.description: Core: moves following small prior-day range more meaningful; divide current 30-min pct by prevday range metric. S1 used nws12_mainz_30_min and nws12_mainz_prevday. Coverage high. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Immediate up-tick speed (mins to 1% up) inverse
results.description: Core: quick moves (low mins to 1% up) indicate strong buying pressure; invert nws12_mainz_1l. S1 single field with high coverage. S3 not needed. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Short-run dispersion: 20-min pct zscore then quantile
results.description: Core: rank cross-section of 20-min pct moves with quantile to pick extremes. S1 uses nws12_mainz_30_min (close proxy); coverage high. Used quantile operator per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by company size
results.description: Core: scale intraday return by market cap (smaller caps amplify move). S1 uses tonlast returns and mktcap; both high coverage. S4 applied. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Reversal after extreme post-news high_exceed_stddev
results.description: Core: if high_exc_stddev extreme positive, short small reversion; used reverse(highexcstddev). S1 single field high coverage. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Trend confirmation: 60-min pct and 120-min pct alignment
results.description: Core: require same sign in 60min and 120min pct changes to confirm trend (multiply signs). S1 uses two timeframes of news_pct fields. Coverage good. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Low-minute volatility breakout (mins_1_chg)
results.description: Core: quick change in mins_1_chg indicates fast moves; use inverse of mins until 1% move. S1 uses nws12_mainz_mins_1_chg coverage 0.9406. S3 not needed. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Post-news implied continuation when session_range_pct small
results.description: Core: small session_range_pct combined with strong 10-min move suggests breakout continuation; divide pct_10min by session_range_pct. S1 uses two fields; session_range_pct coverage high. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Opportunity from large max down amount (buy the dip)
results.description: Core: big max_dn_amt after news often recovers intraday; reverse maxdnamt zscore. S1 uses nws12_mainz_maxdnamt; coverage high. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by low previous-day volume
results.description: Core: strong move on low prev_vol tends to be more idiosyncratic; use news_prev_vol to filter (ts_backfill if low coverage). Prev_vol coverage 0.9733 here (nws12_mainz_prev_vol), so S3 not needed. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Fast vs slow move divergence (1min vs 30min)
results.description: Core: when 1-min move large but 30-min muted, mean reversion expected; subtract 30-min zscore from 1-min zscore. S1 uses two fields with high coverage. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Post-news directional conviction using provider index
results.description: Core: certain providers historically move prices more; multiply pct_10min by provider weight (provider index used as proxy). S1 uses nws12_mainz_10_min and nws12_mainz_provider; provider coverage 0.9741. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Robust momentum via winsorized volstddev
results.description: Core: winsorize volstddev then rank for robust breakout filtering. S1 uses nws12_mainz_volstddev; applied winsorize operator to limit outliers. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Post-news percentile bucket for 5-min move
results.description: Core: bucket 5-min pct into deciles and trade extremes. S1 uses nws12_mainz_5_min and bucket. Coverage acceptable. Kept operators minimal. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Lagged reaction: compare 1-min to 5-min pct
results.description: Core: if 5-min continues the 1-min move, trade with momentum; multiply signs of 1-min and 5-min returns. S1 uses two fields; both high coverage. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Intraday mean reversion in low-tick stocks
results.description: Core: low total ticks implies low liquidity; extreme moves more likely to mean-revert. Multiply reverse of 10-min pct by inverse tot_ticks. S1 uses two fields with high coverage. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Earnings reaction scaled by market cap
results.description: Core: small-cap earnings surprises produce larger percent moves; divide eps_actual zscore by mktcap. S1 uses two robust fields. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Short-term reversal after large 60-min spike
results.description: Core: large 60-min positive spike often partially reverts; reverse ts_zscore on 60-min pct. S1 single field with high coverage. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Volume-weighted momentum: vwap divergence
results.description: Core: divergence between main_vwap and ton_last indicates pressure; use ewma of difference (ts_mean). S1 uses nws12_mainz_mainvwap and tonlast. Coverage high. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Post-news 120-min continuation with volatility filter
results.description: Core: prefer continuation if volstddev low; multiply 120-min pct by inverse volstddev. S1 uses two fields (nws12_mainz_120_min, volstddev). Coverage ok. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Cross-sectional normalization of 30-min pct
results.description: Core: normalize 30-min pct across universe then pick extremes (zscore + normalize). S1 uses nws12_mainz_30_min; applied normalize operator. KEEP_IN_MIND respected. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Reaction speed as momentum filter (mins_3_chg)
results.description: Core: fast 3-minute moves (low mins_3_chg) suggest stronger momentum; invert mins_3_chg and multiply by 10-min pct. S1 uses two fields with high coverage. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Residual move vs index after adjusting for SPY
results.description: Core: regression residual of 60-min returns vs SPY over 60 days (ts_regression) to extract idiosyncratic trend. S1 used ts_regression(y=stock returns, x=SPY returns). Both have high coverage. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: High immediate up-return but low follow-through (fade)
results.description: Core: big 1-min up move but low 30-min continuation indicates fade; subtract 30-min return from 1-min return. S1 uses two fields; coverage high. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Use ts_kurtosis to detect fat-tail movers
results.description: Core: instruments with high kurtosis in short window have extreme moves; use ts_kurtosis on returns. S1 uses ts_kurtosis with tonlast returns. Coverage high. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: News momentum scaled by post-vwap gap
results.description: Core: large postvwap - ton_last that aligns with positive returns indicates conviction. Multiply sign of difference by short returns. S1 uses two fields. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Short-term mean reversion when open_vol extreme
results.description: Core: very high open_vol often means initial overreaction that reverts; reverse open_vol zscore and multiply by 5-min return. S1 uses two fields. open_vol coverage 0.9521. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Momentum of tick intensity
results.description: Core: rapid increase in allticks suggests momentum; use nws12_mainz_allticks ts_zscore. S1 single high-coverage field. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Earnings surprise vs market performance (result_vs_index)
results.description: Core: use result_vs_index (stock minus SPY) as signal; positive residuals imply idiosyncratic strength. S1 uses nws12_mainz_result_vs_index high coverage. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Post-news directional strength filtered by provider frequency
results.description: Core: some providers produce stronger, faster moves; weight pct_5_min by provider index frequency. S1 uses two fields; provider coverage high. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Fast reversal after 30-sec extremes
results.description: Core: extremes in 30-sec often revert in next minute; reverse 30-sec zscore then trade 1-min. S1 uses both fields, coverage high. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Relative volatility breakout: ATR scaled by volstddev
results.description: Core: combine atr_ratio with volstddev to find true breakouts. S1 used two fields with good coverage. S3 not needed. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Post-news continued drift when mins_20_pct_up small
results.description: Core: if it took few minutes to move 20% (mins_20_pct_up low) then strong drift; inverse of nws12_mainz_2p (use 20-min proxy). Coverage high. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Directional bias from EOD vwap relation
results.description: Core: if eod_vwap > ton_last suggests buying pressure after news; use sign(eodvwap - tonlast) times short returns. S1 uses two high-coverage fields. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Short-term mean reversion after large range_stddev
results.description: Core: extreme range_stddev tends to mean revert intra-session; reverse ts_zscore(range_stddev). S1 single field with acceptable coverage (0.6172 for base news_range_stddev but using nws12_mainz_rangestddev which is high). S3 considered: I used nws12_mainz_rangestddev (coverage 0.9691) to avoid low-coverage field. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum persistence measured by ts_count_nans-backed backfill
results.description: Core: fill sparse prevclose if needed and compute momentum; SUGGESTION3 applied when using low-coverage prev_close by ts_backfill, but here I prefer nws12_mainz_prevclose coverage 0.9733 so no backfill. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: High-frequency squeeze indicator (mins to 1% down)
results.description: Core: small mins_1_pct_dn indicates fast down move; invert and trade accordingly. S1 uses nws12_mainz_mins_1_pct_dn (coverage high). Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Use ts_product of small returns to detect compounding moves
results.description: Core: product of consecutive short returns (e.g., 1-min returns over 5) to detect compounding momentum. S1 uses ts_product on tonlast returns. Covered fields high. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Price impact proxy: curr_vol * tot_ticks
results.description: Core: high curr_vol with many ticks implies sustained move; multiply two fields. S1 uses nws12_mainz_curr_vol and nws12_mainz_tot_ticks; both have high coverage. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Reversion after fast multi-minute down moves
results.description: Core: quick multi-minute down moves (mins_5_pct_dn low) imply bounce; invert nws12_mainz_5s and multiply by 5-min zscore. S1 uses two fields with good coverage. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Post-news continuation when percent moves align across windows
results.description: Core: alignment of 5, 10, 30-min percent signs indicates stronger trend; sum signs across windows. S1 uses multiple ts_returns but still <=2 datafields (tonlast + spylast optional omitted). Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Volatility compression breakout: low volstddev then big move
results.description: Core: detect low recent volstddev then a surge in 10-min pct for breakout; multiply inverse volstddev by 10-min pct. S1 uses two fields with high coverage. Confidence 0.67.

results.idea: Momentum conditional on being first news record
results.description: Core: first instance news (newrecord=1) may have stronger effect; multiply result1 by newrecord flag. S1 uses nws12_mainz_result1 and nws12_mainz_newrecord (both high coverage). S4 used. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Gap continuation limited by hump (turnover control)
results.description: Core: apply hump to open-gap signal to reduce turnover and focus on persistent gaps. S1 uses nws12_mainz_opengap with hump operator to control churn. KEEP_IN_MIND applied (operators small). Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Short-term contrarian on extreme eod_vwap moves
results.description: Core: if postvwap deviates extremely from ton_last (zscore), expect partial reversion; reverse zscore of postvwap-tonlast. S1 uses two fields, high coverage. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Signal from minutes-to-3% up/down asymmetry
results.description: Core: asymmetry between mins to up vs down for 3% indicates bias; subtract mins_3s from mins_3l inverse. S1 uses two related fields with high coverage. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by PE quintile
results.description: Core: use bucketed PE (low PE quintile) to tilt momentum; S1 uses peratio and 10-min returns then bucket. Peratio coverage good. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Immediate reaction strength normalized by ticks
results.description: Core: normalize 1-min pct by tot_ticks to avoid illiquidity noise. S1 uses two high-coverage fields. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Use ts_arg_min to detect fresh lows intraday for mean-reversion
results.description: Core: if current index is arg_min for short window, expect bounce; applied ts_arg_min on 30-min series. S1 single field with high coverage. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Aggressive continuation when 120-min and 60-min both extreme
results.description: Core: multiply zscores of 60-min and 120-min returns to get conviction; S1 uses same field over two lookbacks. Coverage high. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Pre-vwap vs open gap mispricing
results.description: Core: if pre_vwap far from day open, expect reversion to vwap; subtract pre_vwap from dayopen. S1 uses nws12_mainz_prevwap and nws12_mainz_dayopen (coverage acceptable). If prevwap low coverage use ts_backfill; here nws12_mainz_prevwap coverage 0.7505 so no backfill. Confidence 0.51.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by recent tick acceleration (allticks delta)
results.description: Core: ts_delta on tot_ticks to detect acceleration of activity; multiply with 10-min pct. S1 uses two fields; both high coverage. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Use ts_scale for time-series normalized breakout
results.description: Core: scale 30-min pct within its recent window to pick persistent breakouts; use ts_scale. S1 single field, coverage high. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Post-news 90-min continuation conditional on low prevday volatility
results.description: Core: strong 90-min move in a low-prevday-vol name has more shelf-life; divide 90-min pct by prevday range stddev. Used nws12_mainz_90_min and nws12_mainz_prevday. Coverage ok. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Signal from minutes to 5% up normalized by mov_vol
results.description: Core: fast 5% moves on low mov_vol are stronger; inverse 5l divided by mov_vol. S1 uses two fields with high coverage. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Earnings momentum persistence via ts_decay_linear
results.description: Core: apply ts_decay_linear to eps_actual to emphasize recent surprises and control turnover. S1 uses nws12_mainz_epsactual; SUGGESTION4 used. KEEP_IN_MIND followed. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Post-news continuation when pre-post VWAP diverge
results.description: Core: if post_vwap >> pre_vwap and positive returns, continuation likely; subtract pre_vwap from postvwap then multiply by 10-min returns. S1 uses two fields (postvwap, prevwap). prevwap coverage 0.7505 acceptable. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: High-frequency momentum after news using 30sec then 1min
results.description: Core: if 30-sec and 1-min returns are aligned, trade momentum; multiply their signs. S1 uses two fields with decent coverage. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Use ts_max_diff on vol_ratio to detect surges
results.description: Core: recent peak in vol_ratio relative to historical max indicates surge; ts_max_diff on vol_ratio. S1 single high-coverage field. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Short-term reversal after extreme open gap in low-liquidity names
results.description: Core: open gap extremes in names with low tot_ticks more likely to revert; multiply reverse opengap by inverse tot_ticks. S1 uses two fields. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Market-adjusted momentum normalized by group (sector proxy omitted)
results.description: Core: subtract SPY return from stock return and zscore to get idiosyncratic move; used ts_zscore of difference. S1 uses nws12_mainz_spylast and tonlast. KEEP_IN_MIND respected. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Use ts_arg_max of volstddev to find fresh volatility peaks
results.description: Core: if current day is arg_max volstddev in window, expect follow-through; ts_arg_max on volstddev. S1 single field with high coverage. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Combine eps surprise and immediate pct for conviction
results.description: Core: multiply eps_actual zscore by 1-min pct to amplify earnings-driven momentum. S1 uses two high-quality fields. Confidence 0.68.

results.idea: Fast bounce after extreme max down percent
results.description: Core: extreme max_down_ret often sees bounce; reverse ts_zscore(maxdown). S1 uses nws12_mainz_maxdown with high coverage. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum persistence gauge via ts_rank over 5 days
results.description: Core: ts_rank of daily returns over 5 days to find persistent winners. S1 uses eod_close/prevclose proxy nws12_mainz_prevclose and tonlast returns; used ts_rank operator. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Low-turnover continuation using hump on signal
results.description: Core: apply hump to a 10-min momentum signal to limit turnover and capture persistent moves. S1 uses hump(ts_zscore(10min)). KEEP_IN_MIND applied. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Trend detection via ts_arg_max on 30-min returns
results.description: Core: find if current time is where return peaked in window; ts_arg_max on 30-min to detect momentum continuation. S1 single field. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Post-news directionality using result2 vs index
results.description: Core: use result2 relative to index as another confirmation metric; ts_zscore on result2. S1 uses nws12_mainz_result2 with high coverage. Confidence 0.60.

results.idea: Use ts_covariance between returns and vol_ratio
results.description: Core: high covariance between returns and vol_ratio indicates volume-driven moves; ts_covariance applied. S1 uses two fields. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Immediate micro reversion when mins_30_seconds show fast spikes
results.description: Core: large 30-sec spikes (nws12_mainz_30_seconds) often reverse over next minute; reverse 30-sec zscore. S1 single field high coverage. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Use ts_backfill for low-coverage prev_close then momentum
results.description: Core: prev_close has low coverage in some datasets; per SUGGESTION3 use ts_backfill(prevclose,5) before computing returns. Here I applied ts_backfill when using low-coverage field. KEEP_IN_MIND kept operators small. Confidence 0.50.

results.idea: Momentum confirmation by two independent short windows
results.description: Core: require agreement between 5-min and 30-min zscores; add them to form conviction metric. S1 uses same field over two windows. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Price-pressure signal via eod_vwap - main_vwap
results.description: Core: divergence between eod_vwap and main_vwap can indicate late-session pressure; subtract them and zscore. S1 uses two fields with high coverage. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Use vec_avg on vector-like minute-series (when available)
results.description: Core: if per-minute vector of pct changes exists, take vec_avg to summarize intraday microtrend; SUGGESTION2 applied when vector fields available; here noted as optional and used only if dataset provides vector field. Because data list doesn't explicitly label vector fields I mark as conditional. Confidence 0.48 (conditional).
results.implementation: vec_avg(news_pct_intraday_vector)  /* use only if vector field exists */

results.idea: Momentum scaled by recent tick volatility (group proxy avoided)
results.description: Core: divide short returns by vec/std proxy of ticks (using ts_std_dev on tot_ticks) to normalize. S1 uses two fields with high coverage. KEEP_IN_MIND respected. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: High-conviction continuation: combine eps zscore and 30-min return zscore
results.description: Core: multiply eps_actual zscore by 30-min return zscore to amplify earnings-driven continuation. S1 uses two strong fields; S4 considered. Confidence 0.69.
